message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about improving neural text simplification models using simplified corpora. The primary focus is on natural language processing (NLP) and specifically on text simplification, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also draws on insights from neural machine translation, which is a subfield of NLP and falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed method involves training an encoder-decoder model using synthetic sentence pairs, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning and falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also evaluates the proposed method on available datasets, which is a common practice in NLP research and falls under the category of natural language processing (cs.NE) and information retrieval (cs.IR).
